title: Sam Faiers fires back at critics who accuse her of being a bad mum to baby Paul
text:
Sam Faiers fires back at critics who accuse her of being a bad mum to baby Paul The star's parenting skills were documented in The Mummy Diaries Share Sam fires back at her critics Share   Thank you for subscribing!   
An angry Sam Faiers has fired back at critics who have accused her of being a bad mum to adorable baby Paul. 
The former TOWIE beauty welcomed her son with her other half Paul Knightley in December 2015 and it was all documented on The Mummy Diaries when she opened the doors of her home to cameras. 
And with her parenting skills out there for everyone to see, some trolls have criticised her parenting skills. 
But hitting back at her haters, she said: “Twitter is the worst. I just get criticised for everything I do." (Photo: Rex Features) (Photo: Rex Features) 
She added to The Sun : “For example what my baby is wearing. I get criticised for weaning and feeding too.” 
Only back in December Sam was criticised by other mums for using her car seat "incorrectly" after sharing a video on Instagram. 
In the seemingly innocent video, the cute tot is pulling funny faces. 
“Words can't describe my love for you my baby... You make me laugh all day long," Sam wrote. Sam and Billie Faiers 
But it wasn't long before it sparked a backlash, with other mums accusing her of using the swivel seat - designed to safely move a baby in and out of the car - in an incorrect manner. 
“She can't be that well advised when several of us have seen her use the seat sideways when it isn't meant to be (and the headrest is too high)!” one wrote under the video. 
Another said: “This isn't the first time she has been seen using the car seat, unfortunately incorrectly." 
While a third argued: “Seat's too big, the head support is around his temples! Should stay in the smaller seat until he's tall enough. He may hit the weight requirements but he's not tall enough.” Sam Faiers (Photo: Rex Features) Video Loading
